reviews.text: I visited Florence this March for 6 days. I searched for hotels through Tripadvisor and bought it through our local agency. The hotel is situated on a quite square, next to a beautiful church Santa Maria Novella. It is close to all main sites - the Dome, Palazzo Vechio, or the area around San Lorenzo church. I had a small but well equipped, quite room with a pleasant bathroom and a good bed. There was no view, but I didnt mind. The double rooms were much bigger and had a view. The hotel is about 100 metres from the train station, it is in walking distance to bus that takes you to the airport. The staff spoke english and also other languages, they were really helpful - booked museum for me (Uffizzi,Accademia and chapels necessary), restaurants and weather. The breakfast includes sweet pastries, cheeses and hams, youghurts and freshly made capuccino etc.It is possible to sit outside on a terrace. The hotel is situated in the second floor of a house, there are security cameras and they lock the entrance for night, there is a lift. The hall is nicely decorated with beautiful ceiling. I would recommend my friends to stay in this hotel if they decide to go to Florence.
reviews.title: Great small hotel in Florence!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Florence is a beautiful town, even more from inside than outside. There are so many art collections to see and the churches (Bargello,Pitti Palace, Palazzo Strozzi...), it is really necessary to plan 5 days for this. If you want to visit villas and/or Fiesole, you need to plan longer. The shopping is also pleasant, more affordable than in Milano. The airport is very small, with very few shops. Unfortunately it is impossible to get into Vassari corridor unless you are a group and plan away ahead. The food is lovely. And I recommend to sit at least once in the famous Rivoire cafe in Piazza Signoria, it is expensive but the view is worth it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were glad that the hotel is so close to the train station in Florence. If you take the underpass from the train station and follow the signs for Santa Maria Novella, you don't even have to bother with crossing the street. The hotel is located on the pedestrian walkway right next to the church.

reviews.text: we stayed here september 11th to the 16th 2008. we booked this hotel through ryanair hotels although the description is exactly the same as trip advisor. we generally liked this hotel the position being the best point . the room was fine the television not great as we could only find one english channel but we didn't really watch it much, when we went to use the shower it was completely broken and must have been for a while so i don't know why anybody else had complained,they did put a whole new shower in fairly promtly though. the breakfasts were ok with luke warm coffee from a machine. the main reason i am writing this review is to let people know that if you were thinking of booking this hotel on its list of property amenities eg swimming pool, sauna, restaurant , nightclub, roomservice and various other things you will be dissapointed as we were to find there are none of these as listed in the hotel description .

reviews.text: Great location, close to train station but far away from it to avoid the slightly dodgy people hanging around. Close to all attractions (daily market too) and close to several good restaurants. Small clean room with modern bathroom, shower only. Staff a bit hit and miss, breakfast ok, basic continental, lovely terrace to sit out and eat on. Air conditioned room - great for the hot days, comfortably bed. Room was cleaned briefly over the 3 nights I stayed there, towels were not changed and floor was not swept but that didn't really bother me - just when you're paying £100 a night you expect it.
